channel.title: Jar Probelm
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I made a .jar for my client, but when I run it it doesn't open. I re-jarred it with the .bat and ran the .bat it says.
'RS2 user Client - release #317' 'Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid'
How do I add arguments into the .jar so I can just make the .jar so I can press the .jar and the client opens. Or what do I need to modify to allow me to do that.
Thanks, Sorry if this is the wrong section.

item.title: Jar Probelm
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:5, topic:449734”][quote author=Whackatre link=topic=552628.msg4049634#msg4049634 date=1342383113]

I’m getting Unhandled Packet 101 now. I think I need the new Init method.

How is that even related to the program arguments…?
[/quote]
Well when I change the Main method, that packet spams and I can’t do anything.[/quote]

Highly unlikely, unless there is something in your main method unrelated to the handling of the passed parameters. If so, just copy it into your new main method.

Read full topic

item.title: Jar Probelm
item.dc:creator: @rova0 rova0
item.description:
@rova0 wrote:

Open client.java and search for:

You will find this method, which contains your error:

public static void main(String args[]) { try { System.out.println("RS2 user client - release #" + 317); if(args.length != 5) { System.out.println("Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid"); return; } nodeID = Integer.parseInt(args[0]); //portOff = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); portOff = 0; if(args[2].equals("lowmem")) setLowMem(); else if(args[2].equals("highmem")) { setHighMem(); } else { System.out.println("Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid"); return; } if(args[3].equals("free")) isMembers = false; else if(args[3].equals("members")) { isMembers = true; } else { System.out.println("Usage: node-id, port-offset, [lowmem/highmem], [free/members], storeid"); return; } signlink.storeid = Integer.parseInt(args[4]); signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); new Jframe(args); //client client1 = new client(); //client1.createClientFrame(503, 765); } catch(Exception exception) { } }

Replace that entire method with this one:

public static void main(String args[]) { try { nodeID = 10; portOff = 0; setLowMem(); isMembers = true; signlink.storeid = 32; signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getLocalHost()); client client1 = new client(); client1.createClientFrame(505, 767); } catch(Exception exception) { } }

Now save, compile, and delete the old .jar file you created. Make a new one following the same steps you have done before and test it and tell us how it goes

Read full topic
